required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: In Vivo Measurement of Corneal Epithelial Changes in Dry Eye Patients
clinical_study.official_title: In Vivo Measurement of Corneal Epithelial Changes in Dry Eye(DE) Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to measure corneal epithelial changes in dry eye subjects using a novel lubricant eye gel.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this study is to measure corneal epithelial changes in dry eye (DE) subjects using a novel lubricant eye gel.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in epithelial irregularity following 4 weeks of treatment with a novel artificial tear gel.
primary_outcome.description: The Changes in epithelial irregularity following 4 weeks of treatment with a novel artificial tear gel.

arm_group.arm_group_label: SYSTANE® Gel Drops Lubricant eye gel
arm_group.description: SYSTANE Gel Drops Lubricant Eye gel dosed (bilaterally) 3 times per day for the 28 day period.

intervention.intervention_name: SYSTANE® Gel Drop lubricant eye gel
intervention.description: SYSTANE Gel Drops Lubricant Eye gel dosed (bilaterally) 3 times per day for the 28 day period.
intervention.arm_group_label: SYSTANE® Gel Drops Lubricant eye gel

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Subjects must have history of dry eye as determined by:
1. Questionnaire
2. Tear Film Break Up Time less than or equal to 10 seconds
3. Schirmer's score of less than or equal to 5 mm
4. Corneal staining greater than or equal to 3 in either eye, and
5. Positive for conjunctival staining (greater than or equal to 1)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients cannot wear contact lenses within 1 week prior nor during the study, and cannot have a history of hypersensitivity to any component of Systane Gel Drops.
